p3System.interfaces

Interface IP3System

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IP2System
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    P3System

    public interface IP3System
extends IP2System
    This is an IP3System. Any implementation should implement this interface.
    Author:
    samus250

    • Method Detail

      • setReferenceVariableValue

        void setReferenceVariableValue(java.lang.String v1Name,
                               java.lang.String v2Name)
                        throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                               InvalidAssignmentException
        Assigns value (address) to a given reference variable.
        Parameters:
        v1Name - the destination variable (the one whose value is changed to the new value).
        v2Name - the source variable (the one whose current value is copied to the destination variable).
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - whenever one of the variables does not exist as a registered variable.
        InvalidAssignmentException - when the variables are valid registered variables, but at least one of the two is not a reference variable or they are reference variables but of different ObjectDataType.

      • setReferenceInstanceFieldValue

        void setReferenceInstanceFieldValue(java.lang.String v1Name,
                                    java.lang.String fName,
                                    java.lang.String v2Name)
                             throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                                    NotReferenceVariableException,
                                    InvalidFieldNameException,
                                    InvalidAssignmentException
        Assigns value to the instance field whose type is an ObjectDataType (hence the field is a reference field). The value to assign is taken from a reference variable.
        Parameters:
        v1Name - the destination variable (the one whose instance field value is changed to the new value).
        fName - the name of the instance field hwose value is to be changed.
        v2Name - the source variable (the one whose current value is copied to the destination variable).
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - when ever one of the variables does not exist as a registered variable.
        NotReferenceVariableException - when the first v1Name is a valid registered variable, but not a reference variable.
        InvalidFieldNameException - when the fName is not a valid field in the ObjectDataType of the reference variable.
        InvalidAssignmentException - when the variables are valid registered variable, as well as the instance field, but at least one of the two, the source variable or the instance field is not of type "reference" or they are of type "reference" but of different ObjectDataType.

      • createAndAssignObject

        void createAndAssignObject(java.lang.String vName)
                    throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                           NotReferenceVariableException
        Reserves space in memory corresponding to a particular object data type, which is the data type of a reference variable that is specified. A block of memory is reserved with size equal to the sum of the sizes of its instance fields. The address of the memory block reserved is assigned (as its address value) to the reference variable. This methods presumes that there is enough memory available.
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the reference variable.
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - whenever the variable does not exist as a registered variable.
        NotReferenceVariableException - when vName is a valid registered variable, but not a reference variable.

      • gc

        void gc()
        Does garbage collection in memory. Marks as "free" or "available" those memory areas corresponding to objects not being referenced anymore. (Releases previously reserved, but not currently in use, memory areas.)

      • compactMemory

        void compactMemory()
        Compacts memory, hence terminating fragmentation. Moves reserved locations as needed for the reserved memory to become a contiguous block at the lower portion of the memory. It also does garbage collection. Any existing variable will continue existing with their current values, but possible moved to other areas in memory.

      • createAndAssignArrayObject

        void createAndAssignArrayObject(java.lang.String vName,
                                java.lang.String tName,
                                int length)
                         throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                                NotArrayVariableException,
                                DataTypeDoesNotExistException,
                                NotPrimitiveDataTypeException,
                                InvalidArrayLengthException
        Reserves a memory area for an array object with elements of a particular primitive data type and assigns its address to a variable of type "array".
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the array variable.
        tName - the name of the data type of array elements.
        length - the length of the array being created.
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - when vName is not the name of a registered variable.
        NotArrayVariableException - when the variable exists but is not of type "array".
        DataTypeDoesNotExistException - if the data type name specified is not a registered data type.
        NotPrimitiveDataTypeException - when the specified data type is not primitive.
        InvalidArrayLengthException - when the value is negative or zero.

      • setArrayElementValue

        void setArrayElementValue(java.lang.String vName,
                          int index,
                          java.lang.String value)
                   throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                          NotAnArrayVariableException,
                          NullArrayReferenceException,
                          java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                          InvalidValueException
        Assigns a value to a given position in an array.
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the array variable.
        index - the index value of the position in the array.
        value - the value to assign.
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if vName is not the name of an existing variable.
        NotAnArrayVariableException - if vName is an existing variable but is not of type "array".
        NullArrayReferenceException - when the array variable has value null.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds.
        InvalidValueException - if the attempted value does not match the particular data type of the array.

      • getArrayElementValue

        java.lang.String getArrayElementValue(java.lang.String vName,
                                      int index)
                               throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                                      NotAnArrayVariableException,
                                      NullArrayReferenceException,
                                      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets a value to a given position in an array.
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the array variable
        index - the index value of the position in the array.
        Returns:
        the value as a String.
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if vName is not the name of an existing variable.
        NotAnArrayVariableException - if vName is an existing variable but is not of type "array".
        NullArrayReferenceException - when the array variable has value null.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds.

      • getArrayLength

        int getArrayLength(java.lang.String vName)
            throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                   NotAnArrayVariableException,
                   NullArrayReferenceException
        Returns the length of an array.
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the array variable.
        Returns:
        the length of the array.
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if vName is not the name of an existing variable.
        NotAnArrayVariableException - if vName is an existing variable but is not of type "array".
        NullArrayReferenceException - when the array variable has value null.
